column2: SOUTH DAKOTA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 2. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
3. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a low place in the road.

column2: 5. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 11. When pedestrians are in a crosswalk, drivers should:
column4: go ahead because drivers have the right-of-way.

14. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: if you wait until the light changes.
column6: after making a complete stop first.
column8: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.

column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

18. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column6: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column8: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.

column2: 19. A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
column6: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 20. In rainy weather, drivers should be most careful when turning or stopping:
column4: when it's been raining all day.
column6: during the first half hour of rain.
column8: after it has been raining for at least two hours.

column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
